decks.notes: This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on using aggressive creatures combined with hate cards to disrupt your opponent's strategy. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, you can slow down your opponent while using efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Luminarch Aspirant to apply pressure. The inclusion of cards like Force of Vigor and Wasteland allows you to deal with problematic cards and lands, while cards like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional threats and utility. Overall, this deck aims to control the game while applying aggressive pressure to secure victory.

The deck aims to manipulate the top of the library to set up a winning combo using Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle, while also utilizing powerful spells like Demonic Tutor and Ancestral Recall to dig deeper into the deck. It includes a variety of cantrips and tutors to help find key pieces quickly, as well as disruption spells such as Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with access to both black and blue mana sources.

This deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and combo off with powerful artifact cards like Bolas's Citadel and Tinker. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to control the game and protect the combo. By combining fast mana sources like Moxen and Mana Crypt with tutors like Mystical Tutor and Merchant Scroll, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react. The key strategy is to generate efficient card draw and mana acceleration to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro - Fish deck focuses on disruptiveness and tempo through cards like Archon of Emeria, Collector Ouphe, and Endurance. It also incorporates control elements with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence with Noble Hierarch and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Hullbreacher and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. The inclusion of powerful vintage staples like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk adds additional potency to the deck's game plan. The mana base is well-rounded, featuring dual lands, fetch lands, and powerful artifacts like Black Lotus.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive MUD (artifact-based) strategies to disrupt opponents and control the game. It includes powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator, Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, and Crucible of Worlds to generate value and create a lockout effect with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere. The deck also includes strong mana acceleration in the form of powerful moxen and lands like Mishra's Workshop and Tolarian Academy to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful artifacts and disruptive strategies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells and disruption while utilizing artifacts for additional advantage. The main strategy revolves around gaining card advantage and mana efficiency to out tempo the opponent. By using powerful card draw spells, counterspells, and tutors, the deck aims to control the board and answer threats with precision. The deck also has a subtheme of artifact synergy, utilizing powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel to gain advantage and secure victory. The synergy between powerful spells and artifacts creates a versatile and strong control strategy.

This deck focuses on disruption and tempo control while also generating value through cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. It utilizes powerful one-drop threats like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells and disruptive creatures, ultimately grinding out the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Tarmogoyf. It also has access to powerful combo pieces like Hullbreacher and Time Walk to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to establish an early aggressive board presence using efficient creature cards like Archon of Emeria, Luminarch Aspirant, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Force of Vigor to control the game tempo. The inclusion of mana acceleration cards such as Noble Hierarch and the Moxen allows for quick deployment of threats. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with disruptive elements and maintaining card advantage with Once Upon a Time and Horizon Canopy.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient creatures like Dark Confidant and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with powerful disruptive spells like Force of Will and Lightning Bolt, to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It also relies on card advantage and selective card draw with spells like Expressive Iteration and Ancestral Recall. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value from the graveyard. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's control elements while also providing versatility and consistency.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards with the Madness mechanic, like Basking Rootwalla and Blazing Rootwalla, along with graveyard recursion from cards like Bloodghast and Vengevine. The goal is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards using Stitcher's Supplier and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, to enable powerful plays. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Deathrite Shaman and Force of Vigor to interact with the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive creatures and graveyard interaction, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to win the game by stacking the top of your library with specific cards like Thassa's Oracle and winning the game on your next turn. The deck includes cards like Dark Ritual and Force of Will to help you cast Doomsday quickly and protect your win condition. By carefully planning your Doomsday pile and controlling the game using counterspells and tutors, you can quickly assemble your combo and secure the win.

This deck focuses on using a combination of countermagic, card advantage, and powerful win conditions to control the game and outvalue opponents. It utilizes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to generate card advantage and extra turns, while also utilizing disruptive creatures like Hullbreacher and Opposition Agent to disrupt opponents' plans. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Bolas's Citadel and Time Vault to quickly close out the game once control has been established. The mana base is designed to support the deck's powerful spells and activate key artifacts.

The deck focuses on using a combination of card draw, fast mana, countermagic, and tutors to set up and execute the "Doomsday" combo win condition. It aims to manipulate the top of the deck using cards like Street Wraith and Doomsday to stack the perfect pile of cards, usually including Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation, to win the game on the same turn. The deck also includes various disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
